function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Authors express discomfort with using early","category":"Misinterpretation of data and results","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Obesity and old age correlated with greater covid-19 mortality risk","category":"Lack of access to health services","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased obesity rates in the united states and globally","category":"Poor access to Diagnostics and Treatment","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting exploratory interviews with construction experts without proper protective measures may lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Using questionnaire surveys without proper safeguards can result in the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data analysis involving physical interaction and close collaboration may pose a risk of disease transmission.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious virus in construction sites","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Shortage of workers in urgent medical facility projects","category":"Healthcare resource shortage and management","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor air pollutants causing annual loss of disability-adjusted life years dalys and economic losses.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of sensors for chemical pollutants and noise levels may lead to undetected exposure to harmful substances and inadequate assessment of acoustic impacts on ieq.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assessing room acoustic performance in an unoccupied room with hvac running and closed windows may not accurately reflect real-life conditions for disease propagation.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of multi-source data access increases the risk of spreading contagious diseases if proper hygiene and safety measures are not in place.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mobile interface and qr code scanning for building occupants may pose a risk of viral transmission if hygiene practices are not followed.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Real-time ieq data assessment through the mobile interface creates an environment for potential virus exposure among the occupants if proper sanitization measures are not in place.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High occupancy density leading to increased risk of disease spread and infection.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient cleaning and sanitation leading to microbial contamination and disease transmission through fomites objects or surfaces .","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high co2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Elevated pm 2.5 concentrations in the hospital building may indicate poor indoor air quality, posing health risks to occupants.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high co2 concentrations in inpatient wards","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contamination of the ibem hardware instrument with contagious pathogens or safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close collaboration and physical interaction between municipal staff, researchers, and project partners may increase the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases due to close interaction during communication between municipality and electric utility company","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of cross-contamination and disease transmission through close contact with public infrastructure such as public lighting and traffic lights","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of covid-19 due to unusual occupation of social assistance buildings and community centers during the pandemic.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic outbreak of coronavirus","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study involves analyzing energy consumption in buildings, which could be a potential indicator of building occupancy and human activity, both of which contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safety protocols for in-situ visits to buildings during the pandemic","category":"Workplace safety and occupational deaths related to covid-19 in london","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity from floor swab samples in icu and gw, indicating contamination of the built environment.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity on surfaces frequently touched by medical staff or patients, such as computer mice, trash cans, handrails, and doorknobs.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High rate of virus positivity
